intro: Thlaspi nudicaule, commonly known as the naked-stemed cabbages or the common rockcress, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of smooth, glabrous leaves and a short, unbranched stem that bears a single flower at the top. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to grow in harsh environments. Thlaspi nudicaule is an annual or biennial plant that is widely distributed across Europe, Asia, and North America.
